item.title: Report E-2023100408
item.description:
Report E-2023100408

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-30
  • City: Selma
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9/30/23, at 2104, personnel in the CSXT Clifton Forge yard reported NATX400224, a loaded tank car of Anhydrous Ammonia, was suspected to leaking. The car was isolated and the shipper, Advansix, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2023-10-01-00001). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, as well as a CSXT Manager of Hazardous Materials, were dispatched to the scene and found product leaking through the pressure relief valve. CSX and contractor personnel contained the release with application of an emergency capping kit until such time that the contents of the leaking car were transloaded into tank car NATX400291. Additionally, response personnel utilized a highway transport truck to unload approximately 4,000 liquid gallons of product that could not be safely loaded into the NATX 400291 due to volumetric outage constraints. Because the leaking car was not equipped with a gauging device, response personnel were unable to determine the specific reason why the identified calf car could not accept the entire load; however, it is suspected that the NATX 400224 was originally overloaded prior to the pressure relief device failure. Upon completion of the product transload, response personnel purged the leaking car to clean/empty status. All issues identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Christian Beale 804-731-8124). While the car was suspected to be overloaded, the pressure relief device continued to leak for the duration of the unloading process- even at acceptable load volume and pressure. Because of the this, the pressure relief device was identified as non-conforming and an AAR form QA 7.1 was filed.

item.title: Report X-2023090774
item.description:
Report X-2023090774

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: NEWPORT NEWS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DELIVERY DRIVER BROUGHT PACKAGE TO DMP. DURING INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED CONTENTS LEAKED INSIDE THE PACKAGE BUT NOT OUTSIDE OF IT. DMP OPENED A LONG PACKAGE THAT HAD 3 SEPARATE FIBERBOARD BOXES INSIDE THAT HELD 12- 20OZ CANS OF MARKING PAINT EACH. EACH BOX WAS SEPARATED WITH AIR BAGS ON TOP OF EACH OTHER. RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023100157
item.description:
Report X-2023100157

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: FREDERICKSBURG
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Tugger driver dropped off hazmat package onto a pallet at the top of van line haphazardly. DescribePack: No spilled liquid outside of package, just a small amount leaked from the lid causing staining to the outside fiberboard. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Lid secured and package was contained within spill bucket.
